intro: Grumilea cagayanensis, commonly known as the Cagayan grumilea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
